title: How to Delete a Teams Meeting from an Outlook Calendar Invite

steps.title: Only if you haven't sent the invite yet.
steps.content: Only if you haven't sent the invite yet. Unfortunately, you can't delete a Teams meeting from an existing Outlook event. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source To get rid of the "Join Teams meeting" or "Join online meeting" button in the invite on peoples' calendars, cancel the meeting, then recreate it without a Teams meeting attached. If you've already sent the invite, you have a few options: Cancel the meeting, then recreate it without a Teams meeting attached. See Removing Teams Before Sending Invites to learn how. Edit the meeting to remove or replace the "Microsoft Teams meeting" text. This will not remove the "Join Teams meeting" or "Join online meeting" button people will see in Outlook, but it will delete the large text in the body that says "Microsoft Teams meeting" and call-in details.

steps.title: If you're still in the process of creating the meeting, you can remove the Teams link.
steps.content: If you're still in the process of creating the meeting, you can remove the Teams link. This will only work if you're still creating the invite in Outlook and haven't yet sent it to guests. New Outlook and Outlook on the Web: Toggle off the "Teams meeting" or "Online meeting" switch at the top of the invite. This switch is only available before you send the invite. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Classic Outlook (desktop): Click ••• at the top and select Don't Host online .

steps.title: Open your calendar in Outlook.
steps.content: Open your calendar in Outlook. Even though you can't get rid of the "Join Teams meeting" button from the invitation, you can delete the "Microsoft Teams meeting" header and join link from the invitation itself. People may still try to join the meeting on Teams if they're using Outlook, as you can't get rid of the "Join" button.

steps.title: Double-click the meeting in your calendar.
steps.content: Double-click the meeting in your calendar. This opens the invitation for editing.

steps.title: Delete the meeting link and text from the body of the invitation.
steps.content: Delete the meeting link and text from the body of the invitation. Remember—even though you're removing the meeting link and associated text, attendees using Outlook will still see a "Join Teams meeting" button on the invitation. Because of this, you may want to replace the text with something that makes it clear there will not be an online version of the meeting—e.g., "There is no online meeting" or "The meeting will be taking place on Zoom , not Teams."

steps.title: Click Save or Send Update to save your changes.
steps.content: Click Save or Send Update to save your changes. This saves your changes. If you're using Outlook Classic, clicking Send Update will send your new version of the invitation to attendees via email. To prevent Outlook from adding Teams links to calendar invitations automatically, jump down to steps for Outlook Classic , Outlook for Web/New Outlook , and Outlook 365 for Mac .

steps.title: Click the File menu and select Options.
steps.content: Click the File menu and select Options . If you don't want Outlook to automatically add Teams meeting links to each invitation, you can make a quick change in your settings. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Use this method if you're using Outlook Classic for Windows. If your version of Outlook doesn't have a "File" menu, see this method .

steps.title: Click Calendar in the left panel.
steps.content: Click Calendar in the left panel. This opens your calendar settings.

steps.title: Uncheck "Add online meeting to all meetings" and click OK.
steps.content: Uncheck "Add online meeting to all meetings" and click OK . Outlook will no longer include a meeting link or a "Join Teams meeting" button on future invitations.

steps.title: Click the gear icon at the top-right corner of Outlook.
steps.content: Click the gear icon at the top-right corner of Outlook. Use this method if you're using New Outlook for Windows or Outlook for Web.

steps.title: Click Calendar in the left panel.
steps.content: Click Calendar in the left panel. Additional options will appear.

steps.title: Click Events and invitations in the center panel.
steps.content: Click Events and invitations in the center panel.

steps.title: Uncheck "Add online meeting to all meetings" and click Save.
steps.content: Uncheck "Add online meeting to all meetings" and click Save . Outlook will no longer add Teams meeting links or a "Join Teams meeting" button to future invitations.

steps.title: Click the Outlook menu and select Settings.
steps.content: Click the Outlook menu and select Settings . This opens your Outlook settings.

steps.title: Click Configure… under "Calendar options."
steps.content: Click Configure… under "Calendar options." You'll see this right next to "Add online meeting to all events."

steps.title: Uncheck "Add online meeting to all events" and click Save.
steps.content: Uncheck "Add online meeting to all events" and click Save . Outlook will no longer include a meeting link or a "Join Teams meeting" button on future invitations.
